snippet: The Obama administration’s measures are part of the first major federal effort to confront a public health problem that takes at least 23,000 lives a year.
abstract: Obama administration announces measures to tackle growing threat of antibiotic resistance; outlines national strategy that includes incentives for development of new drugs, tighter stewardship of existing ones, and improvements in tracking use of antibiotics and microbes that are resistant to them.
lead_paragraph: The Obama administration’s measures are part of the first major federal effort to confront a public health problem that takes at least 23,000 lives a year.

headline.main: U.S. Aims to Curb Peril of Antibiotic Resistance
headline.print_headline: U.S. Aims to Curb Peril of Antibiotic Resistance

keywords.value: Office of Science and Technology Policy
